title: NYY's Boone: TJ surgery for Schmidt 'inevitable'
content: Yankees manager Aaron Boone says it's "pretty much inevitable" that pitcher Clarke Schmidt will undergo Tommy John surgery for a torn UCL in his pitching elbow.

title: Djokovic joins 2 greats with 100th Wimbledon win
content: Novak Djokovic became just the third player in Wimbledon history to reach 100 victories -- after Martina Navratilova and Roger Federer -- with his 6-3, 6-0, 6-4 win in the third round over Miomir Kecmanovic on Saturday.

title: U.S.'s Navarro ousts defending Wimbledon champ
content: American Emma Navarro came back from a set down to eliminate defending Wimbledon champion Barbora Krejcikova 2-6, 6-3, 6-4 in the third round Saturday.

title: Jota funeral: Liverpool squad, family pay respects
content: Family, friends and teammates gathered to pay their respects to Diogo Jota and his brother, Andr√© Silva, whose funerals were held Saturday morning.

title: Ex-Texans, Eagles LB Braman in cancer treatment
content: Former Texans and Eagles linebacker Bryan Braman is undergoing treatment for a rare, aggressive form of cancer, with his longtime agent describing the situation as extremely serious.

title: Verstappen beats Piastri to claim British GP pole
content: Max Verstappen snatched pole position at the British Grand Prix from the two McLarens of Oscar Piastri and Lando Norris with a remarkable lap at the end of Saturday's qualifying session.

title: Philipsen wins TdF opening stage; Pogaƒçar safe
content: Jasper Philipsen won the opening stage of the Tour de France in a sprint to the line, while defending champion Tadej Pogaƒçar finished safely.

title: üèÜ USA vs. Mexico: Gold Cup final preview
content: Sunday's Gold Cup final is a reunion for the Concacaf rivals U.S. and Mexico, but who has the edge heading into the festivities at Houston's NRG Stadium? Here's what you need to know.

title: First-half MVPs for all 30 MLB teams
content: The stars (and storylines) so far, plus how each club's playoff hopes have risen -- or fallen -- this past month.

title: PSG adapt to adversity to oust Bayern Munich at Club World Cup
content: PSG passed one of their most difficult tests of the Club World Cup so far, overcoming two red cards to record a 2-0 victory over Bayern Munich

title: Musiala badly injured vs. PSG in Club World Cup
content: Bayern Munich midfielder Jamal Musiala was taken to hospital after badly injuring his left leg in his team's defeat against Paris Saint-Germain.

title: Santi hopes to 'make fun' of Pulisic after GC final

title: Neves is Jota pallbearer hours after CWC game
content: Al Hilal's R√∫ben Neves and Jo√£o Cancelo flew to Portugal for the funeral of Diogo Jota after an emotional Club World Cup quarterfinal against Fluminense.

title: Ferreira to Maresca: 'Embrace amazing Est√™v√£o'
content: Palmeiras coach Abel Ferreira advised Chelsea counterpart Enzo Maresca to 'embrace Est√™v√£o' after the 18-year-old star was named Club World Cup semifinal Player of the Match in his final game before joining the Blues.

title: Man Utd sign 18yo Paraguayan defender Leon
content: Manchester United have signed 18-year-old Paraguayan defender Diego Leon on Saturday, describing him as "an emerging talent."

title: The art of a team talk: Why great captains, coaches use them to teach, not scream
content: From impassioned shouting to calm instructions, team captains and managers attempt to motivate their players by any means necessary. But which messages actually work?

content: You say you're a fan, but how well do you know your state sports trivia? Cue our second "state check" of the summer.

title: Who‚Äôs the best No. 1 NFL draft pick ever? No. 10? No. 262?!? We named top all-time selections at every slot
content: We went through every NFL draft since 1967 and named the best selection at every slot, from Peyton Manning at No. 1 to Brock Purdy at No. 262.

title: Remembering Diogo Jota, a star whose loss is felt beyond Liverpool
content: The death of Liverpool forward Diogo Jota has caused an outpouring of grief from those associated with the Reds and far beyond. As Jurgen Klopp put it, "there must be a bigger purpose, but I can't see it."

title: Oasis pays tribute to Diogo Jota during first gig of reunion tour
content: At the start of their comeback tour, Oasis paid their respects to the late Liverpool forward Diogo Jota.

title: Euro 2025 Daily: Wales fans light up Lucerne in tournament debut
content: Wales fans celebrated as they made their tournament debut, but they were no match for Netherlands. Here's what you need to know from Saturday's Euro 2025 action.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Arteta sets two-week deadline for Gy√∂keres
content: Arsenal boss Mikel Arteta wants a new striker to be at the club within a fortnight as talks over Viktor Gy√∂keres drag on. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Transfer window weekly: Gy√∂keres close to Arsenal? Chelsea, City to trim squad?
content: The summer transfer window is now open, but what are our reporters hearing about deals that could be done?

title: Meet the 2026 recruits who remind us of some big NBA players

title: Latest rosters for 90-plus teams: Transfers, recruits, more
content: Players leaving. Players joining. We're tracking all personnel movement for key teams heading into 2025-26.

title: Bhanupali-Bilaspur-Beri railway line project: HC issues notice to Centre, H.P. govt. over fissures in houses
content: Villagers have reported big cracks in their homes due to the construction of the tunnel, which is located just 10 metres from some residences, the petition stated

title: Anti-Hindi war creates a storm in Mumbai, says CM Stalin
content: He stated that the BJP government, which had made teaching Hindi a precondition for allocating funds to Tamil Nadu, backed down after the people of Maharashtra raised their voices against Hindi imposition

title: E-vehicle charging station operators disappointed over revision in electricity fixed charges
content: In the recent tariff order, fixed charges for EV charging stations under LT‚ÄìVII tariff category in the above 50-112 kW slab have been increased to ‚Çπ165 per kW per month when compared to the previous tariff of ‚Çπ79 per kW per month

title: Reorganising States into smaller units key to fair delimitation, says expert
content: He highlights the disparity in the value of votes across constituencies, citing a comparison between the Chennai Central and Bangalore North Lok Sabha seats as an example of imbalance

title: Naxals are fighting for rights of the marginalised, says Thirumavalavan
content: On the fourth death anniversary of Father Stan Swamy, a statue in his honour was unveiled at the St. Peter‚Äôs Higher Secondary School in his native village of Viragalur

title: Edappadi K. Palaniswami renews call for like-minded parties to join hands against DMK
content: He says the AIADMK will lead the coalition and form the government after it wins the Assembly election in 2026, and that he will be the Chief Ministerial candidate

title: Farming activity gains pace in Cauvery delta for Kuruvai season
content: Comfortable storage in reservoirs has boosted agricultural operations this year; as on Saturday morning, the Mettur dam had 93 tmcft of storage, barely half a tmcft short of its full capacity

title: PM Modi, Argentine President Milei agree to diversify bilateral trade basket
content: In their wide-ranging talks, the two leaders emphasised on boosting defence cooperation between the two countries as it will serve each other's strategic interests.

title: Prove that Forest Rights Act is responsible for ‚Äònegative‚Äô change to forest cover, Tribal Affairs Ministry tells Environment Ministry
content: The Ministry of Tribal Affairs‚Äô communication comes days after over 150 forest rights and civil society groups wrote to the Centre, taking issue with the latest State of Forest Report attribution of ‚Äúnegative‚Äù change in forest cover to FRA

title: A.P. CM orders release of water into Jeedipalli reservoir under HNSS Project from July 15
content: Naidu stresses the need to fully utilise the inflows coming through the HNSS and Pothireddypadu system for filling reservoirs across Rayalaseema

title: Over one crore electors submit enumeration forms in Bihar
content: Over 93% forms distributed to voters for electoral roll revision; RJD leader Rabri Devi says Centre and State trying to snatch voting rights, and appeals to people not to show any document except voter ID to visiting polling staff

title: M.P. High Court reverses lower court order that granted ownership of ancestral properties to Saif Ali Khan, family
content: The matter pertains to a ownership dispute among the descendants of the last ruler of the princely state of Bhopal, Nawab Hamidullah Khan

title: Supreme Court notifies quota for OBCs, SCs and STs in direct staff recruitments
content: The Chief Justice of India extends reservation to the physically challenged, ex-servicemen and dependents of freedom fighters

title: Communal tension grips Rajasthan town after man beaten to death
content: A 25-year-old man allegedly beaten to death in a minor road accident after his car hit a vegetable cart in a market, causing a crowd to thrash him

title: Kolkata law student rape case: Classes to resume at Kolkata‚Äôs college as probe continues
content: The classes had been suspended after the college campus, particularly the guard room where the incident allegedly unfolded, had been sealed off for the investigation

title: Ganja chocolate smuggler arrested in Vijayawada
content: Accused Subhash Kumar Yadav of Bihar was taking the chocolates to Chennai, say  the Government Railway Police

title: Questions swirl around poll officers‚Äô powers to flag citizenship issues
content: EC guidelines permit electoral registration officers to report suspected foreigner cases to ‚Äúcompetent authorities‚Äù, while the Citizenship Act, 1955 grants only the Home Ministry the authority to decide on citizenship issues

title: Suvendu urges R.G. Kar victim‚Äôs parents to join march against Mamata
content: After the sexual assault of a law college student in Kolkata in June, the BJP leader urged the parents of the R.G. Kar Hospital rape and murder victim to join the march to the State Secretariat on August 9

title: Congress demands special session of Bihar Assembly, claims State is experiencing ‚Äúgoonda raj‚Äù under NDA
content: Congress says special session must also discuss the special intensive revision of electoral rolls, terming it a ‚Äúdeliberate conspiracy‚Äù to help the BJP win the Assembly election to be held later this year

title: Nipah virus: 425 people under observation as Palakkad, Malappuram, Kozhikode put on high alert
content: In Palakkad, 61 out of 110 people on the contact list are health workers, while in Kozhikode, all 87 are listed as health workers. Health Minister advises psychological assistance for those on the contact list

title: U.P. launches temple renovation and tourism plan to preserve cultural heritage
content: The government says the Tourism Department has prepared a detailed roadmap to transform many sacred sites in eastern U.P. into vibrant centres of heritage tourism. The focus is on bringing lesser-known ancient temples and pilgrimage sites onto the global tourism map, it emphasises

title: Age-old Jain practice of Santhara | Starved for salvation
content: A petition in the Madhya Pradesh High Court seeks a ban on the Jain practice of Santhara for minors after a three-year-old girl diagnosed with brain tumour died in Indore allegedly within half an hour of undertaking a ‚Äòfast-unto-death‚Äô.¬†The Hindu¬†reports on the age-old practice and the current debate

title: Delhi High Court quashes 300 Defence Ministry petitions against disability pension to soldiers
content: The Court stresses that disability pension is not an act of generosity but a acknowledgement of the sacrifices soldiers made, which manifest in the form of disabilities/disorders suffered during military service

title: Kaloor stadium to sport a beautified look with fresh coat of paint
content: The beautification work has been progressing since April and is likely to be completed by August. Since its inception, the stadium has been fully painted only once

title: Punjab to impart skill education in business, marketing to school students
content: The State Education Minister Bains says government will provide all technical and financial assistance and that an investment of ‚Çπ17 lakh has been made to set up innovation labs

title: CRDA gives its nod for acquiring additional 20,494 acres in Amaravati
content: The meeting has also authorised the CRDA to dredge sand required for constructions in Amaravati from the upstream of Prakasam Barrage on the Krishna for a period of two years

title: Ministers Lokesh, Farook to attend ‚ÄòRottela Panduga‚Äô in Nellore today
content: Around 1,600 policemen deployed, swimmers and boat patrolling arranged at Swarnala Cheruvu, continuous surveillance with 70 CCTV cameras set up for festivities

title: Grama sabha for LPS 2.0: farmers want clarity on status of Amaravati capital, higher compensation
content: They wonder when Amaravati will officially be notified as the capital and who  guarantees its status in case of a change in government after the next elections

title: ‚ÄòMass expulsions in Russian University killed our medical dreams‚Äô: Indian students allege ‚Äòfinancial gain‚Äô by university
content: Russia‚Äôs Bashkir State Medical University notice states that foreign students will not be allowed to appear for exams due to ‚Äúfailure to fulfil their obligations to conscientiously master the educational program and complete the curriculum‚Äù

title: Make July 9 nationwide strike a success: State-level joint committee of trade unions
content: ‚ÄòThe strike is primarily a resistance towards the four labour codes introduced by the Centre and the privatisation of public property‚Äô

title: Farmers‚Äô response to Amaravati LPS positive, and concerns raised will be addressed, says Tadikonda MLA Sravan Kumar
content: Government targets to pool over 47,000 acres as it will help establish facilities such as Quantum Valley, international airport, and international sports city, which in turn will shore up land values manifold, says the TDP leader

title: H.K. Patil initiates various development works in Gadag district
content: The Minister on Saturday initiated development works at various places in Mallasamurdra of Gadag district

title: One lakh women to be trained, employed before Onam
content: Statewide campaign by Kudumbashree and Vigyan Kerala aims at bringing women out of domestic confines into the economic mainstream¬†

title: Inspection held at TUDA Towers construction site
content: TUDA Vice-Chairman asks project contractor KPC Projects Limited to increase manpower to complete the work within stipulated time

title: MoEF raises questions on NH widening works on forest stretch
content: Works are on the 14.5-km Neriamangalam, Valara, and Adimaly stretch, which is at the intersection of the Kochi-Dhanushkodi National Highway

title: Satheesan calls for Minister‚Äôs resignation citing crisis in Kerala‚Äôs health sector
content: Leader of the Opposition slams government for negligence, propaganda, and collapse of the health sector¬†

title: CBI registers case against Health Ministry, NMC officials, heads of private medical colleges for ‚Äòmanipulating‚Äô inspections
content: It is alleged that the accused officials supplied prior information to the medical colleges to help them subvert the assessment process by temporarily meeting the requirements and also by bribing the NMC inspection team members for favourable reports

title: Haritha Banaganapalle is our aim, says Minister
content: Minister for Roads and Buildings says his wife purchased ‚Çπ30 lakh worth trees of various varieties from Kadiyam nursery in East Godavari and the same will be planted across the town

title: Lalu's 'Owaisi' dilemma: Will RJD align with AIMIM for Bihar polls? Seemanchal holds the key
content: Bihar gears up for crucial elections. Opposition strategists work to counter the ruling NDA. Owaisi's AIMIM seeks alliance with Lalu Yadav's RJD. RJD fears AIMIM could split Muslim votes. AIMIM won five seats in 2020, denting opposition prospects. RJD accuses AIMIM of being BJP's B-team. AIMIM denies the charge and prepares to contest, alliance or not.

title: 'Deeply saddened': PM Modi mourns Texas flood victims; tragedy claims 27 lives
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi expressed his sorrow over the loss of lives in the Texas floods, particularly the children. The devastating floods, triggered by a strong storm, caused the Guadalupe River to surge, sweeping away homes and cars. Rescue teams are actively searching for missing individuals, including girls from Camp Mystic, amidst ongoing flash flood warnings in central Texas.

title: Kolkata rape accused drank in college for hours after assault; warned guard to stay silent
content: Following the gangrape of a student at South Calcutta Law College on June 25, the three accused, Monojit Mishra, Pramit Mukherjee, and Zaib Ahmed, allegedly spent hours drinking in the college guard room. They warned the security guard to remain silent before leaving for dinner.

title: J&K: Terror hideout busted in Poonch; arms and ammo seized
content: Security forces in Poonch district, Jammu and Kashmir on Saturday, have successfully dismantled a terrorist hideout, seizing a significant cache of arms and ammunition. This operation, conducted jointly by the J&K Police and Army, took place ahead of the annual Shri Budha Amarnath Yatra, ensuring enhanced security for the upcoming pilgrimage.

title: SIA files chargesheet against Hizbul chief, 10 others in narco terror case in Jammu
content: The J&K State Investigation Agency (SIA) has filed a chargesheet against 11 accused, including Hizb-ul-Mujahideen chief Syed Salahudeen, in a cross-border narco-terror case. Investigations revealed a terror financing network involving Pakistan-based outfits operating in J&K, raising funds for HM through narcotics smuggling and sale. The network destabilizes peace in J&K by facilitating terrorist activities.

title: Microsoft 'quits' Pakistan after 25 years: Founding country manager says...
content: After 25 years, Microsoft is reportedly exiting Pakistan, a move confirmed by the founding head of Microsoft Pakistan, Jawwad Rehman, via a LinkedIn post. The company commenced operations in June 2000 but has gradually reduced its presence.

title: J&K HC acquits man in wife‚Äôs murder, cites flawed probe
content: The J&K high court overturned Maan Chand's life sentence for his wife's 2012 murder, citing critical flaws in the investigation. The bench highlighted inconsistencies in weapon evidence, questionable autopsy procedures, and timeline discrepancies. The absence of evidence supporting infidelity claims and the failure to address the couple's son's burns further weakened the prosecution's case.

title: Tight technique, and the joy of batting - How Shubman Gill turned a corner in England
content: Team India captain Shubman Gill broke Virat Kohli's record, bettered Sunil Gavaskar's tally in a single match, and was within striking distance of Graham Gooch's 456 vs India at Lord's in 1990. The 25-year-old's aggregate of 430 will be remembered for a very long time because it came at a time when the spotlight only increased on the youngster.

title: Infosys HR notice: IT giant sends 'detailed warning email' to employees; ‚ÄòWe must work‚Ä¶.‚Äô
content: Infosys is sending personalized warnings to employees exceeding standard work hours, a move contrasting founder Narayana Murthy's call for a 70-hour workweek. The company's automated system tracks remote work, alerting employees working beyond 9 hours and 15 minutes daily. This policy shift prioritizes employee well-being and work-life balance amidst health concerns in the IT sector.

title: India hits back on auto tariffs: reserves WTO right; says trade talks with US remain on track
content: India has reserved its right to impose retaliatory tariffs on the US following a 25% tariff on Indian auto parts, a procedural move under WTO safeguards. This action won't impede ongoing trade deal talks, aiming for a $500 billion bilateral trade by 2030. An interim agreement is expected before July 9, but uncertainty remains.

title: 'We don't give enough credit to Mohammed Siraj': Morne Morkel
content: India‚Äôs bowling coach Morne Morkel praised Mohammed Siraj and Akash Deep's performance after their crucial breakthroughs kept the visitors in command. The task for India on the final day is straightforward: take the remaining seven wickets and seal their first-ever Test win at Edgbaston Cricket Ground in Birmingham.

title: Nvidia sets new record: Surpasses Apple & Microsoft
content: Nvidia's market value soared to $3.92 trillion on Thursday, potentially making it the most valuable company ever, driven by Wall Street's AI optimism. Surpassing Apple's previous record, Nvidia's specialized chips are crucial for training large AI models, fueling immense demand. Its market capitalization exceeds the combined value of all publicly listed companies in Canada, Mexico, and even the United Kingdom.

title: Thackeray & sons: What led to Uddhav-Raj reunion after 20 years?
content: After nearly two decades, Raj Thackeray and Uddhav Thackeray reunited, celebrating the Maharashtra government's reversal of its decision to impose Hindi as a third language in schools. Uddhav hinted at a potential alliance with MNS for upcoming local body elections, emphasizing the importance of unity for Maharashtra's interests.

title: Fiery! Shubman Gill shuts down Harry Brook's 'draw' talk with epic reply
content: Shubman Gill's exceptional batting display, marked by centuries in both innings, propelled India to a commanding position in the second Test at Edgbaston. His performance puts India in a strong position to level the series. Gill's achievement places him among legends like Gavaskar and Kohli, solidifying his impact as a captain.

title: Texas flash floods: 27 dead, dozens missing ‚Äî Top developments
content: A powerful storm caused devastating flash floods in Texas. The Guadalupe River overflowed, destroying homes and a summer camp. Many people died, and several are missing. Camp Mystic was completely destroyed. Hundreds of people have been rescued. Rescue efforts are underway. Residents did not receive flood warnings. Rainfall exceeded forecasts. The Texas Hill Country's geography worsened the flooding.

title: Cardi B reacts to Stefon Diggs' European vacation with a cryptic 3-word message that fans can‚Äôt ignore
content: Stefon Diggs, the New England Patriots wide receiver, recently took a luxurious European vacation, sharing stylish photos on Instagram. His posts garnered attention, especially after Cardi B playfully commented on one picture. The rapper also revealed their stay in a lavish French castle, highlighting Diggs' grand romantic gesture and captivating fans with their glamorous lifestyle.

title: Stephen Curry & Ayesha Curry‚Äôs $30m mansion is perfect fit for their growing family
content: Stephen Curry and Ayesha Curry reside in a $30 million mansion in Atherton, California, a luxurious and convenient location near Stephen's workplace. The expansive property features seven bedrooms, nine bathrooms, a large pool, and numerous amenities for their family of six. Following a hamstring injury during the NBA playoffs, Stephen is currently spending time at home with his family.

title: Savannah James shares glimpses from her daughter Zhuri's lavish bedroom
content: Savannah James shared a glimpse into her daughter Zhuri's lavishly decorated room on Instagram, humorously revealing that Zhuri never actually sleeps there. The video captured Zhuri's playful bedtime routine, which included climbing on her bed's wooden structure, prompting a lighthearted exchange with her mother. Amidst family changes, Savannah balances her roles, prioritizing family life and advocating for self-care.

title: NIA: No Dalai Lama or Khalistani link in Himachal raid
content: The National Investigation Agency (NIA) refuted media reports linking its McLeodganj search to the Dalai Lama's security or Khalistani terror financing. The operation was part of an ongoing investigation into the 'US Donkey Route' human trafficking network, which illegally sends people to the United States. Two traffickers were arrested during the raids in Himachal Pradesh and Delhi.

title: Virat Kohli writes special message for 'star boy' Shubman Gill - must read
content: Shubman Gill's remarkable performance in the ongoing Test against England has earned him high praise from Virat Kohli. Gill's record-breaking scores, including a stunning 269 and a 161, propelled India to a dominant position. He surpassed Sunil Gavaskar's long-standing record and joined an elite group of Asian batters with his exceptional performance in SENA countries.

title: IND vs ENG: 'We got India declaring before GTA 6' - Memes break internet
content: India's commanding performance in the second Test against England has sparked a meme frenzy online. Shubman Gill's explosive 161, supported by KL Rahul, Rishabh Pant, and Ravindra Jadeja, propelled India to declare at 427/6, setting England an improbable 608-run target. Fans humorously compared the declaration to the long-awaited GTA 6 release.

title: 'Come, let us unite': MK Stalin hails Thackeray brothers' anti-Hindi power play
content: Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin lauded the Thackeray brothers' unity against alleged Hindi imposition in Maharashtra. He criticized the Centre for withholding funds and questioned the languages taught in Hindi-belt schools. Following protests led by Uddhav Thackeray, the Maharashtra government retreated from making Hindi compulsory.

title: Historic! Neeraj Chopra clinches inaugural NC Classic title with 86.18m throw - Watch
content: Neeraj Chopra triumphed at the inaugural Neeraj Chopra Classic 2025 in Bengaluru, securing first place with an impressive 86.18m throw. In front of a thrilled home crowd, he outperformed a world-class field, including past Olympic and World champions. Julius Yego of Kenya won silver, and Sri Lanka‚Äôs Rumesh Pathirage took bronze.

title: 'Hit below their eardrums': In Mumbai, Thackeray cousins go no-filter
content: Uddhav Thackeray and Raj Thackeray, estranged for over two decades, reunited at a Mumbai rally called Awaj Marathicha, marking their first joint political appearance since 2005. The rally celebrated the reversal of state government resolutions introducing Hindi in primary schools. Uddhav Thackeray announced, signaling a possible new political alliance between the cousins.

title: 'Big fish' bomb maker: Police say terror suspect was inspired by Zakir Naik
content: Andhra Pradesh Police have identified Abubacker Siddique, arrested in Rayachoti, as a key terror operative with bomb-making expertise and links to past attacks. Inspired by Zakir Naik, he allegedly assisted extremist groups and is suspected of involvement in the Bengaluru BJP office bombing and the Madurai pipe-bomb attempt. Authorities seized explosive materials, Isis literature, and digital evidence, investigating his wider network.

title: 'Destroyed evidence': Who is Nehal Modi? Nirav Modi‚Äôs brother held in US
content: Nehal Modi, brother of fugitive Nirav Modi, faces extradition to India after his US arrest on July 4. Accused of money laundering and criminal conspiracy in the Rs 13,000 crore PNB scam, he allegedly siphoned off Rs 6,498 crore. The extradition hearing is set for July 17, 2025, with US prosecutors opposing bail.

title: ‚ÄòNo hurdle if India cooperates‚Äô: Pakistan open to handing over Hafiz, Azhar, says Bilawal Bhutto
content: Bilawal Bhutto Zardari stated Pakistan is open to extraditing terror suspects, including Hafiz Saeed and Masood Azhar, to India as a goodwill gesture, contingent on India's cooperation in providing evidence and witnesses for ongoing domestic cases. He claimed Masood Azhar is likely in Afghanistan and dismissed claims of Hafiz Saeed's freedom, asserting he is in Pakistani custody.

title: Caught on cam: Bizman Gopal Khemka shot dead in Bihar; SIT formed
content: In Patna, businessman Gopal Khemka was fatally shot near his residence, with CCTV footage capturing the bike-borne assailant. The incident occurred close to Gandhi Maidan, prompting a Special Investigation Team (SIT) led by the SP City Central to investigate. This shooting follows a similar attack six years prior, where Khemka's son, a BJP leader, was also killed.

title: Shubman Gill scores ton on Day 4, breaks Sunil Gavaskar‚Äôs 54-year record
content: Shubman Gill's sensational form continued with a century in the second innings at Edgbaston, following his impressive 269 in the first. Gill's stellar performance, including three 100-plus partnerships, places him alongside Indian legends. His aggregate of 369* runs surpasses Sunil Gavaskar's record for India in a single Test.

title: IND vs ENG: Unstoppable! Shubman Gill breaks Virat Kohli's massive record
content: Shubman Gill has eclipsed Virat Kohli's record to become the highest run-scorer in his debut Test series as India's captain. He achieved this feat during the second Test against England at Edgbaston, amassing 460 runs in four innings. Gill's impressive performance, including a remarkable 269, leading a young team in challenging English conditions, underscores his class and composure.

title: PM Modi in Argentina: Why Buenos Aires trip is vital for India
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi's visit to Argentina marks the first bilateral visit by an Indian Prime Minister in 57 years, aiming to strengthen ties in areas like energy, critical minerals, and trade. Discussions with President Javier Milei will focus on cooperation in agriculture, mining, and renewable energy, with India eyeing Argentina's shale reserves and lithium resources for energy security.

title: 'Balasaheb must be blessing me': Fadnavis on Thackeray reunion; takes 'rudali' swipe at Uddhav
content: Maharashtra Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis derided Uddhav Thackeray's speech at a joint rally as a 'rudali' act, not a victory celebration. Fadnavis criticised Uddhav for focusing on his government's fall rather than the language issue. He also took dig at Raj Thackeray, who had humorously credited Fadnavis for uniting him and Uddhav on stage. The rally celebrated the rollback of Hindi as a third language in schools.

title: World Bank: India ranks 4th in income equality, 171 million out of extreme poverty
content: India is now a leading nation in income equality. World Bank data shows India's Gini Index is better than many major economies. Poverty rates have significantly decreased between 2011 and 2023. Government initiatives like PM Jan Dhan Yojana and Aadhaar have boosted financial inclusion. Healthcare access improved through Ayushman Bharat.

title: 'Aapka waqt bura shuru': Hasin Jahan calls Shami characterless
content: The Calcutta High Court has directed cricketer Mohammed Shami to pay Rs 4 lakh monthly to his estranged wife, Hasin Jahan, and their daughter. This includes Rs 1.5 lakh for Jahan and Rs 2.5 lakh for their daughter, retrospectively applied over seven years.

title: PNB scam: Fugitive Nirav Modi's brother Nehal held in US on India's request
content: Nehal Modi, brother of Nirav Modi, has been apprehended in the USA following extradition requests from the ED and CBI. He faces charges of money laundering and criminal conspiracy related to the PNB scam. Investigations reveal his involvement in concealing and transferring illicit funds through shell companies, with a status conference scheduled for July 17, 2025.

title: Electoral roll revision: Rabri asks people to ‚Äòrefuse‚Äô document checks by poll officials
content: Rashtriya Janata Dal urged Bihar residents to resist showing documents beyond voter IDs during the Election Commission's intensive electoral roll revision, alleging a conspiracy to disenfranchise poor voters. The Election Commission defended the revision as a routine update before elections, addressing past complaints about voter list authenticity.

title: Fastest century, youngest ever! 14-year-old Vaibhav Suryavanshi creates history
content: Vaibhav Suryavanshi, a 14-year-old Indian batter, etched his name in history by smashing a century off just 52 balls against England U-19. This explosive innings not only broke Sarfaraz Khan's record to become the youngest Indian to score a Youth ODI century but also surpassed Kamran Ghulam's record for the fastest Youth ODI century.

title: Hindi row: Cong slams Thackeray cousins for hogging credit for govt's rollback
content: Congress has criticized Uddhav and Raj Thackeray for taking sole credit for the government's reversal on introducing Hindi in Maharashtra schools, emphasizing that widespread opposition from various groups led to the decision.

title: India‚Äôs tour of Bangladesh postponed; BCCI issues statement - more inside
content: The highly anticipated India's white-ball tour of Bangladesh, initially scheduled for August 2025, has been postponed to September 2026, according to the BCCI. The series includes three ODIs and three T20Is. The decision was made considering international cricketing commitments and scheduling convenience for both teams. This postponement follows rising diplomatic tensions and logistical concerns.

title: Space burial goes wrong: Capsule with remains of people crashes into Pacific ocean
content: A space burial mission by Celestis, in collaboration with The Exploration Company (TEC), faced a setback when its capsule, carrying the ashes of 166 individuals and cannabis seeds, crashed into the Pacific Ocean. Launched on June 23, 2025, the 'Mission Possible' capsule completed two Earth orbits before a reentry anomaly caused its destruction.

title: IND vs ENG: KL Rahul left baffled as Josh Tongue sends middle stump flying ‚Äî Watch
content: Josh Tongue delivered a stunning blow in the second Test, dismissing KL Rahul with a brilliant delivery. Rahul, who was looking comfortable at 55, was undone by Tongue's pace and precision as the ball crashed into his middle stump. This crucial breakthrough gave England a glimmer of hope on Day 4, ending a promising partnership and shifting the momentum.

title: Naveen Patnaik requests EAM to personally intervene for release of Odisha man kidnapped in Mali
content: Naveen Patnaik has appealed to the External Affairs Ministry for intervention following the suspected abduction of P Venkatramana, an Indian worker from Odisha, after an attack on a cement factory in Mali. The Ministry has confirmed the abduction of three Indian nationals, with the Indian embassy in Bamako coordinating with local authorities.

title: England batter joins cricket‚Äôs embarrassing club during Edgbaston Test
content: Brydon Carse etched his name in cricket's history by recording the 10,000th duck in Test cricket during the second Test between India and England at Edgbaston on July 5, 2025. This milestone occurred amidst a captivating day's play where Mohammed Siraj's fiery spell helped India dismiss England for 407, despite a strong fightback led by Jamie Smith and Harry Brook.

title: Pakistan building collapse: 16 dead, several feared trapped
content: In Karachi's Lyari neighbourhood, a six-storey residential building collapsed, resulting in 16 fatalities and 13 injuries. Rescue teams are tirelessly searching for survivors, with at least eight people still believed to be trapped. Authorities claim the building was declared unsafe and eviction notices were issued, but residents deny receiving them, highlighting the ongoing blame game amidst the tragedy.

title: Kolkata Rape Accused Drank Alcohol In College's Guard Room After Crime: Cops
content: Monojit Mishra, prime accused in the gangrape of a student at South Calcutta Law College, along with his accomplices spent considerable time drinking liquor inside the institute's guard room after committing the crime on June 25.

title: Congress, BJP Stage Protests In Kerala Seeking Minister Veena George's Resignation
content: The Congress-led UDF and BJP staged widespread protests in Kerala seeking the resignation of state Health Minister Veena George over the death of a woman when a portion of the Kottayam Medical College building collapsed.

title: Interpretation Of Constitution Has To Be "Pragmatic": Chief Justice BR Gavai
content: Chief Justice of India Bhushan Ramkrishna Gavai on Saturday said the interpretation of law or the Constitution has to be "pragmatic" and in a way that suits the needs of society.

title: Month After Confessing To 1986 Murder, Kerala Man Claims To Have Killed Again
content: Muhammadali who had last month confessed to killing someone in 1986, when he was a teenager, had committed another murder three years after that.

title: Arrested Terror Suspect "Big Fish" Bomb Maker, Influenced By Zakir Naik: Andhra Pradesh Cops
content: The Andhra Pradesh police on Saturday identified one of the two terror suspects arrested here recently by Tamil Nadu police as a "big fish", with advanced bomb making skills.

title: 4 AC Mechanics Found Dead In Delhi, Cops Suspect Suffocation From Gas Leak
content: Four AC mechanics were found dead in their sleep, allegedly due to suffocation from inhaling toxic fumes, possibly from leakage of chemicals used in AC servicing, inside their home in south Delhi.

title: 300 Myanmar Refugees Flee To Mizoram After 2 Chin Armed Groups Start Fighting
content: Some 300 refugees from Myanmar fled to Mizoram's Zokhawthar village after clashes between two Chin insurgent groups broke out in the neighbouring country, officials said.

title: MLA Says Tipra Motha Could Withdraw Support In Tripura, Chief Downplays Threat
content: Rumblings within the BJP-led government in Tripura have intensified with an MLA of the Tipra Motha Party, which is a key ally, issuing an ultimatum and saying the party could withdraw support.

title: 'Buried Several Bodies': Karnataka Man Confesses, Seeks Legal Protection
content: In a shocking confession, a man from a village in Karnataka has come forward and told the police that he has disposed of the bodies of several people who were murdered.

title: EPS Launches AIADMK's New Logo, Kicks Off 2026 Campaign With Sharp Attack on DMK
content: AIADMK General Secretary Edappadi K Palaniswami (EPS) on Friday launched a new party logo and unveiled the slogan "Protecting People, Redeeming Tamil Nadu" ahead of his state-wide election tour for the 2026 assembly polls.

title: Manipur's Kuki Body Asks Their MLAs Not To Be Part Of New Government
content: An influential body of Manipur's Kuki tribes has asked MLAs from their community not to be a part of the next state government whenever it is formed.

title: "We Are In Trauma": Father Of Kolkata Rape Survivor Speaks To NDTV
content: A pall of gloom descended upon him, the man told NDTV as his 24-year-old daughter telephoned him to say that she had been raped at her college in Kolkata and then requested that he come and pick her up.

title: India Becomes Fourth "Most Equal" Country Globally: World Bank Report
content: Inequality in India has come down significantly between 2011-12 and 2022-23, making it the fourth-most equal country globally, according to a World Bank report.

title: Minister Clears Latur Farmer's Loan After Video Showed Him Pulling Plough
content: Moved by the video of a debt-hit farmer pulling a plough all by himself to till his field in Maharashtra's Latur district, state minister Babasaheb Patil on Saturday cleared his outstanding loan of Rs 42,500, an official release said.

title: Battling 'Hindi Imposition', MK Stalin Welcomes Thackeray Cousins' Reunion
content: Having led the battle against the three-language component of the National Education Policy, which he calls an attempt at 'Hindi imposition' by the BJP, Tamil Nadu Chief Minister MK Stalin has welcomed the coming together of the Thackeray cousins.

title: Video: Punjab Actor's Father, A Doctor, Shot At By Men Posing As Patients
content: A doctor was examining a patient, when a man standing at the door moved in closer and shot at him, shows a disturbing video from Punjab's Moga.

title: Delhi Bird Census: Over 160 Bird Species, 21 First Time Sightings Documented
content: More than 160 bird species including endangered and migratory ones like the greater flamingo and Indian pitta have been recorded across the national capital as part of the Delhi Bird Atlas.

title: 'Bal Thackeray Must Be Blessing Me': Devendra Fadnavis' Jibe At Uddhav, Raj
content: Choosing to respond with sarcasm after the Thackeray cousins' 'Voice of Marathi' rally on Saturday, Maharashtra Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis has said Bal Thackeray must be showering him with blessings for bringing them together.

title: Mindtree Co-Founder Calls Re 1 Salary His "Life's Biggest Wealth"
content: Entrepreneur Subroto Bagchi has shared a picture of his last drawn salary cheque on social media. Mr Bagchi served as the Chief Advisor to the Government of Odisha in Institution and Capacity Building.

title: OPEC+ To Hike Petrol Output To 548,000 Barrels Per Day In August
content: Saudi Arabia, Russia and six other key members of the OPEC+ alliance said they would further increase oil output in August to 548,000 barrels per day.

title: One trade all 30 teams should make this July
content: this year's deadline is going to be complicated . only eight teams are more than five games out of a wild card . it might make for a slow deadline if all those clubs remain in contention by the end of July .

title: Texans' revamped offense coming together heading into training camp
content: the Texans will have a different pass game, multiple rushing schemes and more running in between the tackles . new coordinator Nick Caley will run the show with the texans this offseason . caley says he's in the discovery process when we get to work with them on the field .

title: 'He's trying to get perfection out of me': Jets pushing Sauce Gardner for more
content: the new york Jets ' expectations for Sauce Gardner are reminiscent of the old "Friday Night Lights" movie . he challenged the star cornerback to raise his game to a new level . "the fact that he's trying to get perfection out of me is what I need," he said .

title: Nine players who will score more TDs in 2025
content: 169 instances in which a wide receiver or tight end scored fewer than five touchdowns on 50-plus offensive touches before managing at least 50 touches the very next season . of those 169, 114 (67.5%) scored more touchdowns the next season, focusing in on the 48 players in that group who scored less than three touchdowns during the first year .

title: Walker joins Burnley from City on two-year deal
content: former Tottenham hotspur player Kyle Walker joins burnley on a two-year deal . the move could be worth as much as ¬£5 million to city if certain bonuses are met . he has made over 200 league appearances for the club since joining in 2017 .

title: NBA free agency: LeBron's next move, Denver's deals, more intel
content: the lakers are holding about $8 million with the remains of their midlevel exception . leBron James chose not to be a free agent during the opening week of free agency . olympic gold medalist robert mccarthy is a top free agent . the los Angeles lakers have been holding about $1.5 million in free agency this summer .

title: Orioles' lineup gets a boost, Chapman set to return for Giants
content: fantasy baseball buzz file aims to provide fantasy managers with the intel they need as news breaks around MLB . storms are expected in the area and there could be a delay, though the game will likely play . the Baltimore Orioles lineup received a couple of boosts with Jordan Westburg returning after a five-game absension .

title: NHL free agency tracker: Updated list of the summer signings
content: a slew of re-signings and the trade of Mitch Marner took several big names off the free agent big board . the 2025 draft included 224 prospects finding new homes, and the weekend included trades for Noah Dobson , Charlie Coyle and John Gibson .

title: Steve Cohen, Hal Steinbrenner and the battle for NYC supremacy
content: the Rays and blue Jays are closing in on the Yankees in the AL East race . the rivalry between the two franchises has reached a point that those who have lived the rivalries were skeptical they'd ever see . "the Mets have kind of turned the corner from being that little cousin or little brother or sister," says showalter . they have followed parallel paths so far this season .
